alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Franklin; Madison; Union (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:57PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN FRANKLIN, DELAWARE, NORTHEASTERN MADISON AND EASTERN UNION COUNTIES IN CENTRAL OHIO THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 457 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Richwood to near Lake Darby, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Dublin, Delaware, Powell, Sunbury, Plain City, Ashley, New California, Radnor, Shawnee Hills, Galena, Ostrander, Magnetic Springs, Alum Creek State Park, Delaware State Park, Olive Green, US Route 33 at US Route 42, Warrensburg, Kilbourne and Columbus Zoo. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 123 and 138. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If these storms become stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
